answerText: linear map [or linear transformation; prompt on homomorphism][10] This is the term for the generalization of linear maps to other algebraic structures. In group theory, those that are surjective are called epimorphisms.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Wellesley + Hunter  | 14 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These are maps of vectors such that f of x plus y equals f of x plus f of y and f of ax for constant a equals a times f of x. For 10 points each: [10] Name these maps on vector spaces that include the zero map and the identity map.
